segment.source: Windows Media Player Performance and Quality
segment.target: Windows Media Player Performance and Quality

segment.source: Windows Media Player Performance and Quality
segment.target: Windows Media Player Performance and Quality

segment.source: Windows Media Player Performance and Quality
segment.target: Windows Media Player Performance and Quality

segment.source: The Windows Media Player Performance and Quality assessment starts Windows Media Player and plays multiple media clips one after another.
segment.target: The Windows Media Player Performance and Quality assessment starts Windows Media Player and plays multiple media clips one after another.

segment.source: The focus of this assessment is on the quality and performance of steady-state playback in Windows Media Player, which mimics the workload of a user watching a movie.
segment.target: The focus of this assessment is on the quality and performance of steady-state playback in Windows Media Player, which mimics the workload of a user watching a movie.

segment.source: The results produced by this assessment can help you assess media playing capabilities and performance and quality issues.
segment.target: The results produced by this assessment can help you assess media playing capabilities and performance and quality issues.

segment.source: This assessment does not evaluate any seeking or pausing functionality.
segment.target: This assessment does not evaluate any seeking or pausing functionality.

segment.source: For more information about the results that are produced by this assessment, see Results for the Windows Media Player Performance and Quality Assessment.
segment.target: For more information about the results that are produced by this assessment, see Results for the Windows Media Player Performance and Quality Assessment.

segment.source: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.
segment.target: The following graphic illustrates the assessment process.

segment.source: workflow graphic for windows media player p & q
segment.target: workflow graphic for windows media player p & q

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: System Requirements
segment.target: System Requirements

segment.source: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.
segment.target: When running this assessment on Windows 8.1, make sure the Collect Analysis Trace setting is unchecked when assessing expected battery life.

segment.source: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.
segment.target: When checked, this option will produce an incorrect estimation.

segment.source: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.
segment.target: Enable analysis trace collection only when you need additional information to investigate other energy-related problems.

segment.source: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:
segment.target: You can run this assessment on the following operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Supported architectures include x86-based and x64-based systems.
segment.target: Supported architectures include x86-based and x64-based systems.

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: By default, this assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.
segment.target: Microsoft defines these settings so that you can compare the results across multiple computer configurations or over time on the same computer.

segment.source: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.
segment.target: When you review the results, the run information includes metadata that indicates whether the assessment used the recommended settings.

segment.source: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.
segment.target: The following table describes the assessment settings, recommended values, and alternative values for each setting.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Use recommended settings
segment.target: Use recommended settings

segment.source: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.
segment.target: Specifies whether the assessment uses the recommended settings.

segment.source: By default, this check box is selected.
segment.target: By default, this check box is selected.

segment.source: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.
segment.target: To change the settings for this assessment, you must first clear this check box.

segment.source: Content path
segment.target: Content path

segment.source: Specifies the source folder for the media files.
segment.target: Specifies the source folder for the media files.

segment.source: By default, the folder is located at .
segment.target: By default, the folder is located at .

segment.source: You can use the media files in the default location or specify a different folder.
segment.target: You can use the media files in the default location or specify a different folder.

segment.source: If you supply your own media files, the assessment supports the use of a network folder.
segment.target: If you supply your own media files, the assessment supports the use of a network folder.

segment.source: Test pass type
segment.target: Test pass type

segment.source: Specifies a power option for the assessment.
segment.target: Specifies a power option for the assessment.

segment.source: Select one of the following options from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Select one of the following options from the drop-down list.

segment.source: By default, the power option on a laptop is Tests on AC and DC.
segment.target: By default, the power option on a laptop is Tests on AC and DC.

segment.source: Tests on AC and DC
segment.target: Tests on AC and DC

segment.source: Tests on AC only
segment.target: Tests on AC only

segment.source: Tests on DC only
segment.target: Tests on DC only
